text:
Dark brown to black... Aroma of wood, gin, anise, herbs, berries, light roast... Flavor is chocolate, charred malt, berries, gin, wood, anise... Really good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Growlr at RBSG PGH 2016. Dark brown color, thin tan head. Aroma of burnt medicinal caramel. Taste is herbal caramel. Interesting.

RBSG 2016, Grand Tasting. Growler. Medium nut brown. Light acetic notes mingle with earthy/herbal flavours, some bread and tea. Sweet. Not sure about the light sourness. Actually, not sure about the whole deal here.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Thank you strykezone for my first sahti. Growler RBSG2016 grand tasting. Nice tart aroma, makes my mouth water. Very nice presentation with its big head and all. Slight co2 on the palate. Not as tart as it smells. Likeable herbal feel. Not bitter at all. So, Tom, this is what sahti is all about? Go figger. Thanks Tom for helping me complete my styles list, greatly appreciated! Overall, decent acceptable brew.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Growler shared. The beer is a dark brown with a beige head. Lemon and spice notes. Sugary. Medium body and low carbonation.
Growler - Sweet caramel and herbal notes. Clear copper with a small light brown head. Cola caramel and sweet herbal notes. Very odd.
Growler - pours brown white head - nose/taste of tree bark, oak, cherry, juniper and berry - medium body
Sampled at RBSG16 grand tasting. Pours a murky tan color. Very herbal aroma. Taste was a bit sweet and medicinal. Mouthfeel was medium.

Growler at RBSG thanks tomStrykzone . Pours a amber in color With an off white head.Nose is woody, herbal and ftuity. Medium body. Flavor same as aroma only something like pine or spruce arrives and lingers the finish. Interesting and good.
Growler. Pours a cloudy brown with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is yeast, floral, wood, spice. Medium body, wood, spice, yeast, funky, light finish, good.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 Growler at RBSG. Pours a hazy dark amber copper color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have big herbal spicy, spruce, dark fruit, caramel, wood, interesting mix of flavors.

Bottle sample at RBSG grand tasting. Very herbal, piney with spruce and juniper. Like a shrub. Dark brown clear with thin head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Starts very herbal with spruce and juniper, earth, and piney tart-sweet note. Smoky light herbal after.

Sampler at the brewery. Quite dark murky brown. A beige ring of foam. A vinous aroma of red wine with all kinds of fruit. Earth and anise. Ridiculously complex stuff. I taste the wine, bugs, berries, rich malts, wood, and some latent sourness. Some kind of zing (best I can do to describe it.) I really like it and love the complexity. It is all over the place and everything works together so nicely.
